com.joliciel.talismane.machineLearning.maxent

Interface OpenNLPPerceptronModelTrainer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ClassificationModelTrainer

    public interface OpenNLPPerceptronModelTrainer
extends ClassificationModelTrainer
    Trains a Perceptron machine learning model for a given CorpusEventStream, as described in:
    Discriminative Training Methods for Hidden Markov Models: Theory and Experiments with the Perceptron Algorithm. Michael Collins, EMNLP 2002.
    Uses the Apache OpenNLP OpenMaxent implementation.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

      A parameter accepted by the perceptron model trainer.

      • setTolerance

        void setTolerance(double tolerance)
        Specifies the tolerance. If the change in training set accuracy is less than this, stop iterating.
        Copied from Apache OpenNLP OpenMaxent.

      • getTolerance

      • setStepSizeDecrease

        void setStepSizeDecrease(double stepSizeDecrease)
        Enables and sets step size decrease. The step size is decreased every iteration by the specified value.
        Copied from Apache OpenNLP OpenMaxent.
        Parameters:
        decrease - - step size decrease in percent

      • isUseSkippedAverage

        boolean isUseSkippedAverage()
        Enables skipped averaging, this flag changes the standard averaging to special averaging instead.

        If we are doing averaging, and the current iteration is one of the first 20 or it is a perfect square, then updated the summed parameters.

        The reason we don't take all of them is that the parameters change less toward the end of training, so they drown out the contributions of the more volatile early iterations. The use of perfect squares allows us to sample from successively farther apart iterations.
        Copied from Apache OpenNLP OpenMaxent.

      • setUseSkippedAverage

        void setUseSkippedAverage(boolean useSkippedAverage)
